description.narrative: As the decision on contribution was prepared in templates (before the introduction of Trac), the objectives of the intervention are not clearly stated in the decision and appraisal document. Since this is a guarantee, the expected results in USAID's initial programme document mainly focus on financial outcomes and the banks performance: OUTPUTS: With the guarantee, it is expected that Centenary bank will increase its level of lending to the health sector, both in terms of numbers of loans and amounts, by engaging loan officers to actively seek borrowers in this sector with the support of the guarantee. OUTCOMES: After the guarantee concludes, Centenary bank would have significantly increased its lending portfolio to private sector health care enterprises. IMPACTS: USAID anticipates that as Centenary bank takes a visible leading role in the Ugandan financial services sector on how to sustainably and profitably extend credit to the private health sector, the economic viability and creditworthiness of this sector will become self-evident to the commercial financial institutions.
Health guarantee in cooperation to increase accesst to financing for the private sector health facilities.
Hälsogaranti i samarbete med USAID för att möjliggöra satsningar inom privata sektorn för hälsa

participating-org.narrative: USAID/United States Agency for International Development

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: According to the last and final extract report shared with Sida in June 2018, at the end of March 2018 utilization of the $3 million health guarantee at Centenary Bank had reached a cumulative total of UGX 6,592,000,000 ($2,585,098). This represents a 86.2% cumulative utilization rate, compared to the target of 100 percent. By the end of March 2018, a total of 123 loans had been disbursed to 89 borrowers (61 rural and 28 urban) and 86 loans worth UGX 4,594,000,000 ($1,801,569), amounting to 60.1 percent of the total guarantee amount, had been fully paid off. Borrowers had defaulted on only four loans, with initial loan amounts totaling UGX 243 million ($95,294, or 3.2 percent of the DCA portfolio).Centenary had written off three of these loans with initial loan amounts totaling UGX 178 million (about $70,000 or 2.3 percent of the DCA portfolio) and outstanding balances totaling UGX 98,877,281 (about $38,775 or 1.3 percent of the DCA portfolio). Centenary was preparing to submit claims against the guarantee for 50 percent of the outstanding principal balance.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
